bg.x2d.anim
Class RotationSegment

java.lang.Object
  bg.x2d.anim.RotationSegment
All Implemented Interfaces:
Segment
public class RotationSegment
extends Object
implements Segment

Segment that rotates the AffineTransform a specified number of degrees, over a specified amount of time and around an optional anchor point.

Since:
2DX 1.0 (1st Edition)
Author:
Brian Groenke

Constructor Detail

RotationSegment

public RotationSegment(int deltaTheta,
                       long duration,
                       Point2D anchor)
Creates a new RotationSegment that rotates deltaTheta degrees for duration milliseconds around anchor point.

Parameters:
deltaTheta - the total degrees to rotate
duration - the total time duration for the segment
anchor - anchor point for the rotation; if null, the Graphics object default anchor will be used (usually the x,y coordinate of drawn objects).

RotationSegment

public RotationSegment(int deltaTheta,
                       long duration)
Calls RotationSegment(deltaTheta, duration, null).

Parameters:
deltaTheta -
duration -
See Also:
RotationSegment(int,long,Point2D)

getDuration

public long getDuration()
Description copied from interface: Segment
Fetches the time duration of this Segment.

Specified by:
getDuration in interface Segment
Returns:
the time duration in milliseconds.

getUpdateInterval

public double getUpdateInterval()
Description copied from interface: Segment
Gets the update increment value for each millisecond of time. For Segments that use more than one interval (x and y for instance), this method will return some sort of combination between the two (average, hypotenuse, etc).

Specified by:
getUpdateInterval in interface Segment
Returns:
the degrees rotated each millisecond (approximate)

transform

public void transform(AffineTransform affine,
                      Transform tf)
Description copied from interface: Segment
Performs this Segment's cumulative operations on this AffineTransform since the last call. If this Segment has been completed and is no longer valid, this method does nothing.

Specified by:
transform in interface Segment
tf - data for ongoing transformations

Description copied from interface: Segment
Checks to see if this Segment has completed or not (valid if not completed, not valid otherwise).

Specified by:
isValid in interface Segment
Returns:
true if this Segment hasn't been started or is in progress, false otherwise.

Description copied from interface: Segment
